sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Find (A × B) ∪ (B × A) and (B × A) ∪ (A × B) and show that they are not equal, proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
